description: Surrey County Council is proposing to build a dry material recycling centre in North West Surrey.
title: Surrey council plans for a new recycling centre in Chertsey
title_page: Surrey council plans for a new recycling centre in Chertsey  - BBC News
maintext:
Plans for a new recycling centre in Chertsey have been released.
Surrey County Council (SCC) is proposing to build a dry material recycling centre on Trumps Farm, North West Surrey, as it says the existing infrastructure is "under strain".
The plans set out that waste will be separated, with metal, cardboard and plastic in one material stream and mixed items including paper, card, plastic, metal and glass in another, said the Local Democracy Reporting Service.
Tim Oliver, leader of SCC, said at a cabinet meeting: "If we're going to build and invest in a recycling centre, we need to up our recycling rates." He is encouraging everyone to check waste items before they are discarded.
